Convenient End-to-End Encryption for E-Mail

Decentralized

Autocrypt-capable mail apps work with any e-mail provider. You and your friends can use your existing e-mail addresses.

Open Standard

Autocrypt is an open specification for e-mail encryption. Under the hood, it uses OpenPGP and other e-mail standards.

What is Autocrypt?

Autocrypt is not an app, but there are autocrypt-enabled mail-apps. Autocrypt is a specification for convenient end-to-end-encryption of E-Mails. Mail application programmers are currently implementing it.

Does it already work?

The first specification was released in December 2017. A few mail programs are already Autocrypt-capable, some want to reach autocrypt-capability in spring 2018.

Please join us in implementing and refining "Level 1" and other upcoming specifications. For any further questions or feedback, see our Contact Page.
